SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

com.centimia.orm.jaqu.annotation
Annotation Type One2Many

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface One2Many

Use to set a field for a one to many relationship.

  1. Relation and Table must have a primary key, and primary key must be defined before relationship
  2. If using a relation table there is no sense of having the Parent object as a field of the child. Doing so will yield an error!

Note: The generic type if exists, is used to infer the other object, otherwise use the 'childType' property. In oneToMany, lazyLoading is the default, but eager load can be done. The relationship can be Two sided (can be seen from both objects) or one sided (can be seen from parent only). Also, implementation of the relation can be done by a relation table or by a foreign key relation, both are supported, if no relation table is given a foreign key is assumed.

Author:
Shai Bentin

Optional Element Summary
 CascadeType cascadeType
          Only Cascade Delete is supported.
 java.lang.Class<?> childPkType
          When using a relationTable to maintain the relationship, the other side of the relation primary key field java type could be named here.
 java.lang.Class<?> childType
          Optional - the class type of the related object.
 boolean eagerLoad
          Set to true if data should be loaded on object load.
 java.lang.String joinTableName
          the name of the DB table maintaining the relationship.
 java.lang.String relationColumnName
          Relevant only when using a relation table, since when using a Foreign Key the relation is maintained in the
child table and jaQu knows this from the child type
The name of the column representing the other side of the relation.
 java.lang.String relationFieldName
          The name of the field in the many side object holding the other side of the relationship.
 

childType

public abstract java.lang.Class<?> childType
Optional - the class type of the related object. Inferred by the generic type if exists.

Default:
java.lang.Object.class

joinTableName

public abstract java.lang.String joinTableName
the name of the DB table maintaining the relationship. (when it is maintained in a relation table and not by Foreign Key)
Default no relation table

Default:
""

relationColumnName

public abstract java.lang.String relationColumnName
Relevant only when using a relation table, since when using a Foreign Key the relation is maintained in the
child table and jaQu knows this from the child type
The name of the column representing the other side of the relation. If not present JaQu will use the simple java class name of the child entity.

Default:
""

relationFieldName

public abstract java.lang.String relationFieldName
The name of the field in the many side object holding the other side of the relationship.
If null 'this' tableName will be used!

Note:

  1. When using a relation table this is the name of the column representing the parent object in the relation table.
  2. In a single sided relationship, When not using a relationship table, a column FK must exist in the child table,
    even if it does not exist in the object

Default:
""

childPkType

public abstract java.lang.Class<?> childPkType
When using a relationTable to maintain the relationship, the other side of the relation primary key field java type could be named here. If not named JaQu will attempt to find it, or fail to set up the relation table.

Default:
java.lang.Object.class

eagerLoad

public abstract boolean eagerLoad
Set to true if data should be loaded on object load. Be careful when using eager load so you don't pool to much of the DB on each call. Default false

Default:
false

cascadeType

public abstract CascadeType cascadeType
Only Cascade Delete is supported. Default is CascadeType.NONE, which means the related objects are not deleted when parent is deleted.

Default:
com.centimia.orm.jaqu.CascadeType.NONE
